results.title: The efficacy of metformin for the treatment of psoriasis: a meta-analysis study
results.text_hl: Overall, compared with control intervention for @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ intervention resulted in significantly increased @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@ area severity index (PASI) 75% reduction (odds ratio (OR) = 22.02; 95% confidence interval (CI): 2.12 to 228.49; p = 0.01), and @<m>DISEASE_Penile_Induration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010411 @@@erythema, scaling and induration@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Penile_Induration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010411 @@@ESI@@@) 75% reduction (OR = 9.12; 95% CI: 2.13 to 39.02; p = 0.003), and was associated with substantially decreased fasting plasma @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ (FPG, standard mean difference (SMD) = -0.59; 95% CI: -0.92 to -0.26; p = 0.0005), @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglycerides@@@ (SMD = -0.92; 95% CI: -1.38 to -0.47; p < 0.0001), total @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ (SMD = -0.77; 95% CI: -1.22 to -0.32; p = 0.00008), and low-density lipoprotein (LDL, SMD = -0.67; 95% CI: -1.12 to -0.23; p = 0.003).
